msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol 2

div1.p: In the United States Circuit Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division
In the matter of the application of Columbia George for writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court. JUN 1 1906. A. Reeves Ayres, Clerk. A.N. Moore, Dep.
Service of the written Petition for appeal accepted hereby which received this 1st day of June 1906
In the United States Circuit Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the matter of the Application of Columbia George, for a writ of Habeas Corpus. No. 1390
To the Honorable C.H. Handford, District Judge, and one of the judges of the above-named Court, presiding therein;

The above named petitioner in the above-entitled cause conceiving himself agrieved by the order of said court made and entered therein, under date of April 27th 1906, wherein and whereby, among other things, it was ordered, That the application of the said Columbia George for a writ of Habeas Corpus herein, be, and the same hereby is, denied". And" That the order to show cause heretofore issued in this cause, be and the same is hereby, quashed." And" that the petition for a writ of Habeas Corpus of the said Columbia George filed herein on the 24th day fo February 1906 be, and the same hereby is dismissed"; and he prays that this his petition for his appeal may be allowed, and that a transcript of the record, proceedings, and papers upon which said order was made, duly authenticated, may be sent to the United Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit. Dated May 22 1906
The foregoing petition for appeal is granted, and the claim for appeal therein made is allowed.
District Judge, and one of the judges of said United States Circuit Court, presiding
